decks.notes: The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, while also utilizing burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to finish off the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride to buff up the creatures and give them additional abilities. The inclusion of Seasoned Pyromancer and Elegant Parlor helps with card advantage and board presence, while cards like Static Prison and Thraben Charm provide disruption and control options. The goal is to maintain pressure and tempo throughout the game to secure a swift victory.

This deck focuses on aggressively attacking the opponent with a mix of efficient creatures and burn spells, aiming to deal damage quickly and overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls provide early aggression, while cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Goblin Bombardment offer additional reach. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Arena of Glory help pump up the team and provide additional threats. The deck also includes some disruptive elements like Static Prison to slow down the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to win through fast and efficient damage output.

This deck focuses on a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to put pressure on the opponent while also controlling the board. By using cards like Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, and Relic of Progenitus, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while quickly closing out the game with powerful creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Ketramose, the New Dawn. The strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggression and disruption, forcing them to constantly react to the threats posed by the deck.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand, then using cards like Goryo's Vengeance to bring them back onto the battlefield for a strong reanimation combo. The inclusion of Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Flooded Strand helps with consistency and control elements. Ephemerate and Solitude provide additional protection and removal options. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing instant reanimation as its main mechanic to win the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient spells. By utilizing cards like Mox Opal, Mishra's Bauble, and Urza's Saga, the deck can generate mana and card advantage to maintain pressure on the opponent. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide additional card advantage and recursion, while cards like Galvanic Blast and Lightning Bolt can quickly finish off opponents or remove threats. The inclusion of expressive iteration allows for card selection and synergy with the deck's overall game plan.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on early aggression and constant pressure, utilizing cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ocelot Pride to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It also includes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Goblin Bombardment for additional damage and disruption. The deck aims to maintain board control and chip away at the opponent's life total, while also having some protection and removal options with cards like Thraben Charm and Static Prison. Overall, the deck's key concept is to win the game quickly through aggressive and efficient attacks.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Broodscale Bloodchief combo to generate massive amounts of value and overwhelm the opponent. By assembling the combo pieces such as Walking Ballista and Glaring Fleshraker, players can quickly build a formidable board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes powerful support cards like Ancient Stirrings and Malevolent Rumble to enhance the combo's effectiveness. With efficient mana acceleration and protection from cards like Boseiju, Who Endures, the deck aims to establish control and dominate the battlefield.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures while maintaining control over the opponent's board with spells like Kozilek's Command and Kozilek's Return. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and Sire of Seven Deaths, while disrupting their game plan with cards like Malevolent Rumble. The deck also utilizes cards like Ugin's Labyrinth and World Breaker to slow down the opponent's strategy while setting up for a big finish.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and pressure the opponent's life total quickly. The inclusion of hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Kozilek's Command, helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying powerful threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Nethergoyf to close out the game. The deck also includes utility lands like Urza's Saga and Eldrazi Temple to generate additional value and mana efficiency, making it a versatile and potent aggro deck.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of cards to generate card advantage and manipulate the graveyard, ultimately leading to a win condition of decking out the opponent or dealing damage with Malevolent Rumble. It utilizes artifacts and graveyard recursion to fuel its game plan, while also including disruptive elements like Engineered Explosives and Tormod's Crypt to control the board. The deck aims to out value opponents through card draw and recursion, while also having the potential to win quickly through its combo pieces.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a variety of spells and creatures to disrupt your opponent's strategy while setting up for a powerful combo finish using cards like Thundertrap Trainer, Lotus Bloom, and Goblin Charbelcher. By controlling the board with counterspells and removal, as well as using cards like Tameshi, Reality Architect and Fallaji Archaeologist for value, you can create a win condition that can come out of nowhere and overwhelm your opponent in the late game.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly play aggressive creatures like Guide of Souls, Seasoned Pyromancer, and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, while using cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to deal direct damage to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to provide additional threats and board control. Additionally, Arena of Glory and Static Prison help to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect your own creatures. The overall strategy focuses on fast, efficient aggression to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on aggressive creature gameplay while disrupting the opponent's strategy with taxing effects. It aims to control the board with cards like Flickerwisp and Solitude while pressuring the opponent with creatures like Emperor of Bones and Overlord of the Balemurk. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Relic of Progenitus to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is designed to support both white and black spells, allowing for a diverse range of disruption and aggro strategies.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while utilizing aggressive creatures to apply pressure. It aims to control the board through removal spells like Fatal Push and Solitude, while creatures like Flickerwisp and Boggart Trawler provide utility and evasion. The deck also utilizes cards like Thoughtseize and Relic of Progenitus to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain card advantage. The combination of disruptive elements and aggressive creatures allows the deck to outmaneuver opponents and secure victories through a combination of tempo advantage and creature damage.

This deck utilizes the Amulet Titan combo to quickly ramp up mana and search for key pieces, such as Primeval Titan, in order to overwhelm the opponent with large creatures and powerful land triggers. Utilizing cards like Amulet of Vigor and Explore to generate massive amounts of mana, the deck focuses on efficiently searching for combo pieces and utilizing lands such as Urza's Saga and Gruul Turf to create a powerful board state that can quickly close out the game.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through hand disruption, counterspells, and removal spells. It aims to control the game by efficiently dealing with threats while setting up its own win conditions with powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and card advantage engines like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck also includes a mix of card draw, graveyard hate, and utility lands to adapt to different matchups and ensure consistent control over the game.
